div1.p: Territory of Washington County of Lincoln}ss
In the District Court of the 4th Judicial District of Washington Territory holding terms at Cheney for the counties of Spokane Lincoln and Douglas

Wilson D. Coyle being duly sworn says he is the defendant in the above entitled case, and that in addition and supplemental to the affidavit for Continuance by affiant heretofore made and now on file in the case affiant further states that in the premises in the indictment herein stated he acted in necessary defense of affiants person from great and impending harm; that affiant did strike the said Charles Seaman the person in the said indictment named at the time and place

alleged, but that affiant was compelled so to do in order to protect himself from an assault from the said Seaman who at the time was endeavoring to inflict great bodily hurt as affiant then and there verily believed on this affiant and was then and there making such apparent demonstration of inflicting such serious bodliy hurt as then and there presented such appearance of actual and immediate danger as to justify a reasonable man placed as affiant then and there was in doing as affiant did: That said Seaman had immediately before said after thereabout to do great bodily harm to affiant, and affiant then and there believed said Seaman was then and there about to carry said threat into Execution and would have done so had not affiant protected himself by striking said Seaman as he was then and there compelled to do and did do, and

said act of self defense can the supposed crime charged against affiant that the said threats mentioned in affiants other affidavit influenced affiant in so defending himself against said threatened assault Wilson D. Coyle
Sworn to and subscribed before me this 23d day of April 1885 W.H. Smallwood Notary Public
In the District Court of the 4th judicial district of Wash Ter holding terms at Cheney
Territory of Washington vs. Wilson D. Coyle
Indicted for assault with intent to commit murder
File April 23-85 Kate W. Feuerbach Clerk By R. Strobach Deputy
